intro: Veronica foliosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved speedwell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plantaginaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
